revised_title: Micelle Structure and Swelling of Wool Fibre
tldr: The authors studied the elastic properties of wool fibers in various liquids to determine the size of capillary spaces in the dry and swollen fibers. They discovered a micellar structure and found that swelling increases the capillary size, making the fiber more accessible to reagents. This research provides a better understanding of the internal structure of wool fibers and can help predict dye fastness and processing in the textile industry.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Materials Science
